etymologies: mid 16th century; earliest use found in Leonard Digges (c1515–?c1559), mathematician. From classical Latin statēra kind of balance, steelyard, in early use partly via Italian stadera, †statera

definitions: A scale or balance consisting of a lever with arms of unequal length, which moves on a fulcrum.

notes.text: After 18th century, chiefly with reference to ancient Roman devices.
